meanings.definition: A covering or structure that provides shade or protection, typically made of fabric or branches.
meanings.sent1: The canopies at the park shielded us from the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The canopies on the beach umbrellas kept us cool.
meanings.sent3: The colorful canopies at the market fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The canopies of the trees embraced the forest like a protective hug.
meanings.sent5: The canopies of the tents created a cozy atmosphere for the campers.

meanings.definition: The uppermost layer of branches in a forest or tree.
meanings.sent1: Birds build nests in the canopies of tall trees.
meanings.sent2: The monkeys swung from the canopies of the jungle trees.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels raced through the canopies, playing tag.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filtered through the canopies, creating a dappled effect on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The wind rustled the canopies of the trees, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A cloth covering hung or held up over a person or object.
meanings.sent1: The royal carriage was adorned with luxurious canopies.
meanings.sent2: The bride and groom walked under elegant canopies at the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out from under one of the canopies.
meanings.sent4: The canopies billowed in the wind like sails on a ship.
meanings.sent5: The canopies of the tents fluttered gently in the evening breeze.
